Job Title: ServiceNow Business Development Director

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
ServiceNow Business Development Director 
Summary: The ServiceNow Business Development Director is responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive business development strategy to drive increased revenue growth for the company. The role is responsible for developing strategies to create new business opportunities to acquire new business, retain current profitable clients, and grow the market share. This role will define and execute new business opportunities supporting the company's growth objectives. This role works closely with the Chief Digital Officer, Head of Digital Transformation, Director of Customer Success, and other members of the executive team to develop and execute the business development strategy for the ServiceNow practice.  Duties/Responsibilities: Establishes and grows key relationships in the product, marketing, and go-to-market (sales) organizations within ServiceNow.Establishes and maintains relationships with the ServiceNow regional sales leadership and their teams responsible for the Healthcare and Life Sciences (HCLS) vertical and any other healthcare related organizations including but not limited to hospitals/health systems, life sciences, payer, and medical universities. Develops a routine cadence for updates to account planning, execution, and integration into OHIT core sales teams for existing accounts and relationships. Develops and maintains green-field account plans to penetrate new logo accounts for OHIT in conjunction with ServiceNow account teams, adding new logo accounts as customers. Collaborates with OHIT Marketing, Sales and ServiceNow Practice leadership on account-based marketing and sales strategies targeting priority target pursuits. Develops and executes strategies to grow existing OHIT accounts where MSAs are already established into additional OHIT service lines. Diligently monitors and documents all business development activity for active pursuits in coordination with respective OHIT and ServiceNow account teams using established tools and processes. Works closely with ServiceNow Operations Administrator to submit and maintain deal registration records within the ServiceNow Partner Portal with a deliberate focus on driving sourced and influenced Net New Annual Contract Value (NNACV). Quota attainment for greenfield/new logo as well as support of closing deals within existing OHIT accounts when needed. Manages and facilitates contract execution processes between OHIT, ServiceNow (if applicable) and the customer. Tracks emerging markets and trends. Expands the profile and reach of the company and its brands. Evaluates existing partnerships and sales efforts with an eye toward building on what works and changing what doesnâ€™t. Fosters and works to maintain an entrepreneurial growth culture throughout the company and across all teams and work functions. Proposes and develops strategic partnerships. Travels to client locations regularly to maintain, build and foster relationships. Conducts webinars and presentations to raise the brand and product profile. Fulfills requests for proposals (RFPs) from potential partners and customers.  Required Skills/Abilities:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills. Executive presence and presentation skills. Ability to act with discretion, tact, and professionalism in all situations. Ability to collaborate and manage change across all service lines. Ability to learn and retain industry and product related information to support the business development and account management processes. Extreme attention to detail. Unquestionable adherence to ethical and moral business standards. Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing relationships with external vendors and partners. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 
Education and Experience: B.S degree or equivalent experience required. 7-10 years of technical business development experience required. 3-5 years of ServiceNow specific business development/sales experience desired. Previous experience partnering and growing relationships with digital transformation companies required. Healthcare industry experience required. Familiarity with ServiceNow a strong plus.

Experience Level (if available): Director
